body.p:
Your plugin most of the times needs to interract with the end user. You can find below some possibilities to do that:
Your plugin can create Swing components (dialogs, frames) based on the Java Swing architecture and can show them when custom actions added by the plugin are called. You can also extend the Oxygen specific API base class OKCancelDialog to create a dialog which already has Ok and Cancel buttons added to it. This specific dialog base also automatically resizes its internal components depending on the current used fonts or DPI settings and also properly positions its OK/Cancel buttons depending on the operating system in which Oxygen is started (on Mac OSX the OK button is on the right part of the dialog while on Windows and Linux it's placed on the left part of the dialog). There is an entire API package which contains base implementations of Swing components and such implementations are recommanded to be used in order for the plugin-contributed components to look like the ones contributed by Oxygen.
The WorkspaceUtilities API allows you to:
Show file and folder choosers
Show confirmation dialogs.
Show information/warning or error dialogs.
Show a custom status message in the application.
The ResultsManager API allows you to add results in the application's Results view, results which can point to a specific document at a specific line/column location.
